Comment: We had a budget surplus during the Clinton 2nd term because Republicans in Congress led by Newt Gingrich cut taxes and reformed work requirements for welfare spending.  The solution isn't about spending less but growing spending more slowly than revenue is growing. If we grow at 3% revenue will naturally grow. However if we grow spending 4% which we typically do we still grow the deficit. If we grew spending at 1% but grew the econmy at 3% we could balance the budget in 10 years and begin to pay down the debt without raising taxes and without cutting spending.
